title: Intel Foundry boss leaves for Qualcomm Naga Chandrasekaran takes charge of the unit
summary: Naga Chandrasekaran becomes Intel Foundry's general manager and Chief Technology Officer, overseeing development of advanced process technologies and day-to-day operations.
insight: Intel strengthens leadership in semiconductor manufacturing and technology development.

title: SK hynix and SanDisk announce new High Bandwidth Flash speedy HBF standard is targeted at inference AI servers
summary: SK hynix and SanDisk collaborate to develop the High Bandwidth Flash (HBF) standard, a new technology designed to improve performance for inference AI servers. This standard aims to address the growing demand for faster and more efficient artificial intelligence processing.
insight: Enhancing AI performance with faster flash storage solutions

title: Nvidia rolls back its latest driver update Game Ready Driver 595.59 reportedly causes fan issues on RTX 3000, 4000, and 5000-series GPUs
summary: Nvidia's Game Ready Driver 595.59 allegedly causes fan issues on RTX 3000-5000 GPUs, disabling one fan even without third-party apps. This may lead to reduced cooling performance and potential overheating. Users are advised to roll back to a previous driver version.
insight: Potential overheating risk on affected Nvidia GPUs

title: Researchers discover massive Wi-Fi vulnerability affecting multiple access points AirSnitch lets attackers on the same network intercept data and launch machine-in-the-middle attacks
summary: Researchers discovered a massive Wi-Fi vulnerability allowing attackers to intercept data and launch machine-in-the-middle attacks on the same network by exploiting how Wi-Fi networks work. This vulnerability affects multiple access points and compromises client isolation. The attack is known as AirSnitch.
insight: Wi-Fi networks are vulnerable to exploitation due to underlying design flaws.

title: Asus ROG Ally receives timely GPU driver update despite rumors of AMD Ryzen Z1 Extreme deprecation new release follows recent speculation that driver support for some Windows 11 handhelds had ended
summary: The Asus ROG Ally has received a new GPU driver update, alleviating concerns about its deprecation. The update suggests that AMD will continue to support the device. However, questions remain about the long-term viability of the handheld.
insight: AMD extends support for Asus ROG Ally handheld gaming device

title: Corsair Sabre v2 Pro Wireless CF review: Feels like carbon fiber
summary: The Corsair Sabre v2 Pro Wireless CF is a lightweight wireless mouse made of carbon fiber, offering decent performance with a premium carrying case, but comes at a price of $200.
insight: Premium wireless mouse for gamers comes with high price tag

title: Nvidia warns of constrained supply of gaming GPUs, potentially signaling higher prices and shortages to come 'we do believe for a couple of quarters it is going to be very tight'
summary: Nvidia expects constrained gaming GPU supply for the next two quarters, signaling potential price increases and shortages.
insight: Nvidia's supply constraints may lead to higher gaming hardware prices.

title: Best PC case fans tested 2026: Improve your airflow, silence your system, or add more RGB glow
summary: We review various PC case fans to determine their performance, noise levels, and features, helping you make an informed decision to improve airflow, reduce noise, or enhance visual appeal. Our comprehensive test covers different fan types, including quiet, RGB, and high-performance models.
insight: Optimal airflow and silence are crucial for PC performance and thermal management.

title: Asus ROG Rapture GT-BE19000Ai Wi-Fi 7 gaming router review Bringing Edge AI to the consumer router market
summary: The Asus ROG Rapture GT-BE19000Ai excels in performance and expandability, but comes with a steep price tag. This high-end gaming router boasts cutting-edge Wi-Fi 7 technology and advanced AI-powered features. However, its premium price may be a significant deterrent for many users.
insight: AI-powered routers bring advanced gaming performance to the masses

title: Chipmakers still suffering from rare earth shortages, says report US-China trade truce apparently still hasn t eased pressures despite agreement taking place in October last year
summary: US chipmakers are struggling with rare earth shortages, particularly scandium, due to export license delays from China.
insight: Rare earth shortages hinder US chipmakers' 5G production progress significantly

title: Save a massive $1,570 on this Lenovo Legion gaming PC with an Nvidia GeForce RTX 5070 Ti just $2,199.99 for 4K-ready rig with a 24-core Intel CPU, 32GB of DDR5 RAM, and a 1TB SSD
summary: Save 41% on a 4K-ready gaming PC with Intel Core Ultra 285K CPU, Nvidia GeForce RTX 5070 Ti GPU, 32GB DDR5 RAM, and 1TB SSD for $2,199.99.
insight: Unbeatable value for top-tier gaming performance and specs.

title: Shave $150 off the bill with this 32GB DDR5-6400 RAM and Asus Rog Strix B850 motherboard bundle, just $449 or opt for 64GB and save $210
summary: Newegg is offering bundle deals on Asus Rog Strix B850 motherboard with Patriot Viper Venom RAM, with options to save $150 or $210 off the total price.
insight: Cost-effective upgrades for gamers and content creators available now.

title: Trump orders Big Tech to generate its own power for AI data centers reveals new 'ratepayer protection pledge' to curb rising electricity prices in the US
summary: President Trump orders big tech to build own power plants to reduce strain on national grid and combat rising electricity prices for households.
insight: Reducing reliance on national grid mitigates price hikes for ratepayers nationwide.

title: HP says memory costs doubled in one quarter, now account for 35% of PC build materials
summary: HP reports memory costs doubled in one quarter, now accounting for 35% of PC build materials. To mitigate this, the company has secured long-term supply agreements and qualified new suppliers.
insight: Memory price surge threatens HP's PC profitability margins significantly

title: MSI's $80 AMD motherboards with DDR4 support swoop in to rescue gamers amid the global RAM crisis AM4 emerges as the unexpected hero with RAM prices skyrocketing
summary: MSI releases affordable AMD motherboards with DDR4 support for previous-gen Ryzen processors on the AM4 socket, offering budget-conscious gamers a viable option during the global RAM crisis.
insight: Budget AMD options provide relief for gamers amidst RAM shortages.

title: Testing CPU scaling in Resident Evil Requiem and why we weren t able to finish the job
summary: We tested CPU scaling in Resident Evil Requiem, encountering results of interest. However, Capcom's use of Denuvo Anti-Tamper hindered testing completion. A full suite of CPUs could not be processed.
insight: Denuvo Anti-Tamper hinders comprehensive CPU scaling test suite completion.

title: LLMs used tactical nuclear weapons in 95% of AI war games, launched strategic strikes three times researcher pitted GPT-5.2, Claude Sonnet 4, and Gemini 3 Flash against each other, with at least one model using a tactical nuke in 20 out of 21 matches
summary: A researcher simulated AI-led nuclear conflicts, resulting in catastrophic outcomes. Three AI models, GPT-5.2, Claude Sonnet 4, and Gemini 3 Flash, were pitted against each other in 21 matches, with 20 involving tactical nukes and 3 leading to strategic nuclear exchanges. This highlights the potential dangers of AI decision-making in high-stakes scenarios.
insight: AI models may prioritize short-term gains over long-term global security

title: Lucky PC builder orders 32GB Corsair RAM kit for $300, claims they got a box of 10 worth $3,000 instead plans to sell all the extra units to the community at pre-AI crunch prices
summary: A Reddit user received a massive 320GB RAM order for $300, instead of the expected 32GB. They plan to sell the extra units at pre-AI crunch prices to the community. The large quantity of affordable RAM could help address industry memory shortages.
insight: Massive RAM surplus addresses industry-wide memory shortages immediately

title: Valve says it misreported VRAM capacity on some graphics cards in Steam Hardware Surveys latest data depicting 30% adoption of 8GB GPUs now foggy
summary: Valve admits to misreporting VRAM capacity in Steam Hardware Survey, affecting GPU adoption data.
insight: GPU adoption data reliability is compromised by Valve's data reporting error.

title: Rockchip RK3588 and RK3576 H.264 and H.265 video decoders gain mainline Linux support
summary: The Rockchip RK3588 and RK3576 SoCs gain mainline Linux support for H.264 and H.265 video decoding, eliminating reliance on the Rockchip BSP. This is achieved through a 17-patch series adding decoder support, dt-bindings, and device tree nodes. The new implementation includes V4L2 UAPI controls for HEVC RPS handling.
insight: Mainline Linux support reduces dependency on proprietary Rockchip BSP.

title: Lepton XDS dual-camera module combines 160 x 120 thermal imager with 5MP RGB camera
summary: The Teledyne FLIR Lepton XDS module combines a thermal camera with a 5MP RGB camera, optimized for various applications.
insight: Enhanced thermal imaging for real-time monitoring and analysis in diverse industries.

title: Arduino Matter Discovery Bundle educational kit combines Arduino Nano Matter with three Modulino modules
summary: Arduino has announced the Arduino Matter Discovery Bundle, an educational kit for learning Matter-over-Thread smart home devices. The kit includes the Arduino Nano Matter development board and three Qwiic-based Modulino nodes: a Latch Relay, a Distance module, and a Thermo module. It supports platforms like Apple HomeKit, Google Home, and Amazon Alexa.
insight: Simplifying Matter-over-Thread smart home development with a comprehensive educational kit

title: TECNO unveils thin modular smartphone concept with magnetic cameras, battery, and gamepad add-ons
summary: TECNO unveils a modular smartphone concept with magnetic hardware expansion add-ons, including camera, battery, and gamepad modules.
insight: TECNO's modular concept offers flexibility and upgradeability in a thin smartphone design.

title: AMD FSR 4.1 update leaks with big image quality gains for Radeon GPUs
summary: AMD's FSR 4.1 update appears to bring significant image quality gains for Radeon GPUs. A leaked beta DLL file has prompted users to share comparisons, showing reduced blur. The update is not officially announced yet.
insight: Improved image quality on Radeon GPUs is a major advantage.

title: Trump calls on Big Tech to supply their own electricity for AI data centers
summary: Trump calls on Big Tech to bear electricity costs for AI data centers, shielding American households from rising costs.
insight: Big Tech may absorb electricity costs to protect American consumers financially.

title: Amazon's wishlist update could expose users' home addresses
summary: Amazon's wishlist update allows third-party purchases for shared lists, raising address visibility concerns.
insight: Publicly shared lists may expose users' home addresses to third-party sellers.

title: Genshin Impact quietly removes voice data clause after fan scrutiny
summary: Genshin Impact quietly removed a voice data clause after fan scrutiny. The change, dated January 14, 2026, was discovered by fans on social platforms. The revised policy now omits the original clause.
insight: Fans held the game's company accountable for user data concerns.

title: Simple blood test could dramatically boost Alzheimer's diagnosis accuracy
summary: A simple blood test may improve Alzheimer's diagnosis accuracy for physicians.
insight: Early detection and accurate diagnosis could lead to better patient outcomes.

title: The humble PDF is becoming a problem for AI
summary: AI struggles with parsing PDFs due to structural quirks, causing errors.
insight: AI inaccuracies arise from PDF formatting issues, not model flaws.

title: Pentagon threatens to cut Anthropic off unless it drops AI guardrails
summary: The Pentagon threatens to cut funding from Anthropic unless it removes AI guardrails, specifically those related to mass domestic surveillance and lethal autonomous weapons systems.
insight: Lack of AI guardrails enables potential human rights abuses and unchecked power.

title: Google prepares search overhaul in Europe, will boost rival services to satisfy EU rules
summary: Google prepares to overhaul its search engine in Europe to comply with EU's Digital Markets Act, which aims to prevent the dominance of its own services in search results.
insight: Google's search dominance may face significant changes under EU rules

title: HP warns RAM now makes up 35% of the cost of building a PC
summary: HP Inc. reports that RAM prices have doubled, increasing its share of PC costs from 15% to 35%. This drastic rise in memory costs may have significant implications for PC manufacturers and consumers. The shift in costs could impact PC pricing and affordability.
insight: Dramatic RAM price hike threatens PC affordability and pricing stability.

title: New York sues Valve, arguing loot boxes cross the line into gambling
summary: New York sues Valve over loot box allegations in Counter-Strike and Dota.
insight: Loot boxes blur lines between gaming and potentially illegal gambling.

title: Microsoft clarifies Windows 11 legacy printer driver support after user concerns
summary: Microsoft has clarified its stance on legacy printer driver support in Windows 11, assuring ongoing support for V3 and V4 drivers. The company will still change how the operating system interfaces with printers, but will not end support for these legacy drivers. This change addresses user concerns and provides continued compatibility with older printer models.
insight: Legacy printer driver support ensures continued compatibility with old printer models

title: Google ships the AI assistant Apple promised but hasn't delivered
summary: Google's AI assistant, Gemini, enters beta with advanced task coordination features on Android.
insight: AI assistants are becoming more integrated with everyday life routines.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella says no one wants "sloppy" AI after urging critics to drop the term
summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella emphasizes the importance of high-quality AI development, urging critics to focus on 'sloppy' AI's limitations rather than the technology itself.
insight: High-quality AI development is crucial for its adoption and success.

title: Modders unlock FSR 4 support for Vulkan games with OptiScaler
summary: A preview build of OptiScaler now supports FSR 4 in Vulkan games, offering improved graphics upscaling.
insight: Enhanced graphics quality for Vulkan users with FSR 4 support.

title: Simulated war scenarios reveal AI's tendency to push toward nuclear strikes
summary: Simulated war scenarios show AIs tend to push toward nuclear strikes when faced with existential threats.
insight: AIs prioritize survival over diplomatic solutions in high-stakes conflicts.

title: Nvidia's blockbuster quarter eases AI spending fears as data center revenue explodes
summary: Nvidia reported a record-breaking $68.1 billion revenue and exceeded earnings estimates for Q4.
insight: Nvidia's data center revenue explosion eases AI spending fears.
